channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Death toll rises to 37 in Israeli strike that killed Hezbollah commanders in Beirut
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The deaths of Ibrahim Aqil and Ahmed Wehbe marked the first time in the war that two Hezbollah commanders had been killed by Israel in single day.

item.title: Hezbollah hits Israeli air base after strikes kill its operatives in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Bryan Pietsch, Lior Soroka, Kyle Rempfer

item.title: Israeli warplanes pound southern Lebanon as war fears escalate
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason, Miriam Berger, Karen DeYoung, Susannah George, Lior Soroka
item.description: In northern Israel, fighter jets roared as they streaked across the border late Saturday.

item.title: For Americans scarred by Beirut bombings, a measure of delayed justice
item.dc:creator: Rory Laverty, Dan Lamothe
item.description: Hezbollah commander Ibrahim Aqil, whom Israel says was killed on Friday, was wanted for bombing the U.S Marine barracks and embassy in Beirut in 1983.

item.title: Gaza’s Health Ministry reports 22 killed in Israeli strike on school
item.dc:creator: Rachel Chason, Hazem Balousha, Lior Soroka

item.title: France names a new government, seeking to end turmoil from July’s election
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Marisa Bellack
item.description: The cabinet named by Prime Minister Michel Barnier marks a tilt to the right and will need to avoid being dissolved with a no-confidence vote

item.title: Exploding pagers leave clues to Israeli ‘red button’ plot, officials say
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller, Cate Brown, Loveday Morris, Shira Rubin, Jon Swaine
item.description: Current and former security officials say the attack capped a multiyear effort, involving rigged electronics and European front companies, to penetrate Hezbollah.

item.title: Death toll in Beirut strike rises to 37, capping week of attacks in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: ‘People are afraid,’ Beirut resident says, as rescuers work at strike site
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: What to know about Hezbollah, the group targeted by Israel in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth, Adam Taylor, Victoria Bisset
item.description: Hezbollah is one of the most powerful militant groups in the Middle East, a major political and social force in Lebanon, and a decades-long opponent of Israel.

item.title: At U.N. Security Council meeting, members urge restraint in escalating conflict
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Sri Lanka votes in first election since financial meltdown
item.dc:creator: Karishma Mehrotra, Hafeel Farisz
item.description: More than three dozen candidates are vying to lead Sri Lanka out of an economic collapse that led to the 2022 ouster of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

item.title: Zelensky to appeal to Biden’s legacy in plea to lift Ukraine weapons limits
item.dc:creator: Siobhán O'Grady, Kostiantyn Khudov, Serhii Korolchuk
item.description: Zelensky said he also expects to meet Democratic presidential candidate Vice President Kamala Harris and Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.

item.title: Israel kills senior Hezbollah commander in strike on Beirut suburb
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Mohamad El Chamaa, Miriam Berger, Susannah George, Victoria Bisset
item.description: Hezbollah confirmed that senior leader Ibrahim Aqil was killed in the strike, which capped a bloody week of attacks across Lebanon amid fears of a wider war.

item.title: Israel’s pager attack an intelligence triumph, with uncertain ends
item.dc:creator: Shane Harris
item.description: After Israel turned Hezbollah’s communications system against it with deadly force, officials and experts wonder if a bigger war is coming.

item.title: Who was Ibrahim Aqil? The Hezbollah leader was killed in an Israeli strike.
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: Israel targets senior Hezbollah commander in Beirut suburb
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Victoria Bisset, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Major Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike, militant group says
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Andrew Jeong, Sammy Westfall, Louisa Loveluck
item.description: The strike on a suburb of Lebanon’s capital killed Ibrahim Aqil, a prominent Hezbollah leader, and other senior commanders, Israel said. The attack left 14 people dead.

item.title: Who was Ibrahim Aqil, the Hezbollah leader killed in Israeli strike?
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall, Susannah George
item.description: Aqil was a Hezbollah leader who sat on the group’s military council. He was wanted by the U.S. government for organizing a spate of bombings in the 1980s.

item.title: Israeli forces shove at least four men off West Bank roof, videos show
item.dc:creator: Meg Kelly, Bryan Pietsch, Jonathan Baran
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces are investigating the episode, which it said went against “IDF values.” The United States has called for an investigation.

item.dc:creator: Meg Kelly

item.title: Mohamed al-Fayed, billionaire and friend of U.K. royalty, accused of rape
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: London’s Harrods department store must take responsibility, said a legal team representing 37 accusers, including six Americans.

item.title: E.U. to loan Ukraine up to $39 billion backed by frozen Russian assets
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Beatriz Ríos
item.description: G-7 nations had promised Ukraine at least $50 billion using frozen Russian assets, but there were differences between the United States and the European Union over implementation.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah exchange fire as tensions escalate on Lebanon border
item.dc:creator: Victoria Bisset, Andrew Jeong

item.title: Taiwan says exploding pagers not produced there; Japanese company probes walkie-talkies
item.dc:creator: Julia Mio Inuma, Vic Chiang

item.title: Women’s soccer players, muscled and sweaty, are a new kind of influencer
item.dc:creator: Lorena Rios, Verónica Gabriela Cárdenas
item.description: Mexican soccer players are attracting millions of social media followers while challenging gender norms in the traditionally macho country.

item.title: Washington and the West struggle for a way forward with Putin’s Russia
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Michael Birnbaum
item.description: In the United States and Europe, there is growing uncertainty about how to counter Putin’s aggression without stoking a direct conflict with Russia.

item.title: Video: What we know about Israeli attacks on Hezbollah devices
item.dc:creator: Joe Snell, Shane Harris

item.title: The Chinese economy is faltering — and that means more trade tensions
item.dc:creator: Katrina Northrop
item.description: Growth in the world’s second-largest economy is slowing and stock markets are in decline, but the Chinese government remains reluctant to act.
